runners.spotlight: Useful Flat stayer; raced a bit too freely on last month's stable/hurdle debut at Market Rasen (2m, good) but was still too good for the odds-on favourite, and both placed horses won next time out; good chance.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Supporting Irish Champions Weekend Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Howth is a fine, big horse and looked capable of winning a maiden. It's nice to win one with him - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We might look at the Dee Stakes for him. He has a lot of experience but hasn't gone beyond a mile yet. I think after his first run of the season, which was over seven furlongs, he definitely needs to go up in trip, so Chester could help to tell us where he fits in. 19-04-22

He was among the Ballydoyle team last year and looks a lovely addition to the team. I managed to get a couple of runs into him at the back end, finishing off with a very encouraging second at Chelmsford. He didn't get a clear run and yet was beaten only half a length. We'll bring him back on the grass this year and hopefully he should be ready to run in May. He has improvement in him and his mark of 92 looks very workable. He's decent over a mile but I feel 1m2f will be his forte. 22-03-23

runners.name: Francesi
runners.comment: Placed on the Flat in April but has modest strike-rate; makes hurdle debut today
runners.spotlight: Placed on the Flat five weeks ago (1m, AW; RPR 66) but has very modest strike-rate in that sphere (1-35) and is not the force of old; his stamina for hurdling is not copper-bottomed and he'll need to take very well to this game to pose a threat here.

runners.name: Alvesta
runners.comment: Has taken pretty well to hurdling but has a bit to find with the top two on the racecard
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer; has taken pretty well to hurdling this spring but faded into fourth in low-grade Huntingdon handicap (2m, good) 12 days ago has a bit to find with the top two on the racecard here.

5:00.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Fillies' Handicap
5:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.3)

runners.name: Treasure
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Strong feeling of unfinished business and drop back to 1m (debut C&D win) isn't ridiculous
runners.spotlight: Ran in the Oaks one year ago but tailed off; easily best of three subsequent starts when going down by a neck with her very late bid in a handicap at Newmarket (1m2f, good to soft) in October; 5lb higher today, which demands better, but there's a strong feeling of unfinished business and this drop back to 1m (first time since C&D winner on 2yo debut) isn't ridiculous.

quotes.race: William Hill Oaks Trial Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was a super run and there were no hiding places. I think in time my filly might be the one to take out of the race, especially on softer ground. Treasure's big, she towers over them, and she'll improve for the run compared to some of them. They looked very tight and fit and knew their job, while she was a bit lost halfway through. She'll be smart in time - Rossa Ryan, rider.

quotes.race: EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Treasure was a little behind the bridle early but the further she went, the better she went and it was a nice performance - Ben Curtis, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She's good at hiding her light under a bushel. Initially she didn't show up at home at all, but to our surprise she turned it on when we started galloping her. She'll go to the Oaks Trial at Lingfield, which I think will suit her best. 15-04-24

runners.name: Yokkell
runners.breeder: R Hyland, J T Heffernan & P Hyland
runners.comment: Successful return to Flat in five-runner handicap over C&D, making all and unchallenged
runners.spotlight: Left John McConnell prior to making a successful return to the Flat in five-runner handicap over C&D (good to firm) 33 days ago, making all and unchallenged; 3lb higher today and unlikely to be given so much rope following that career-best Flat effort.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: It wasn't too much of a surprise they couldn't get to Yokkell after opening up that lead ? she stays well and had been showing plenty of speed at home - Kevin Philippart De Foy, trainer.

quotes.race: Hovis (Prev. Premier Bakeries Ireland) Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Yokkell is a really nice filly. She has that bit of class and has the aptitude for hurdling. Alex thinks there is plenty of improvement - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Happy Christmas From All At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Yokkell is going to get hit a bit now from the handicapper but is entitled to be. We have trip options and we actually bought her to go jumping and that is something to look forward to in the future - John McConnell, trainer

quotes.race: @Tipperaryraces Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Yokkell has shown a nice turn of foot and has been consistent around that trip in 3yo handicaps. Whether or not she can step up against the older ones, we don't know, but we'll find out as the year progresses. I wouldn't rule out jumping hurdles with her - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Gaiety Musical
runners.comment: Four AW wins this year and beaten a neck latest outing; 2024 turf runs are less convincing
runners.spotlight: Four wins from ten starts on the AW this year and beaten a neck on latest outing; big player if that form is transferred to turf but her four turf runs (all last year) are a lot less convincing; 7lb claimer is recruited.

runners.name: Alessia Fernanda
runners.comment: 1-15 in Ireland; won British debut from the front in five-runner Musselburgh race (1m1f)
runners.spotlight: 1-15 for Dermot Weld in Ireland, the win over 1m last October in first-time blinkers; that headgear was dispensed with by new yard when she made a winning British debut from the front in five-runner race at Musselburgh (1m1f) six weeks ago; up 3lb and should face competition for the lead but she has to be considered.

runners.name: Jowddah
runners.comment: Justified favouritism as 3yo in AW maiden (1m) and handicap at Yarmouth (7f, good to firm)
runners.spotlight: Started her career with three seconds but returned this season to justify favouritism, always prominent, in a maiden at Newcastle (1m, AW) and ten-runner handicap at Yarmouth (7f, good to firm); up 3lb since showing improvement last time and she could have more to give.

runners.name: Supermodel
runners.comment: Both 2yo runs were 7f on heavy, impressive on debut but floundering in a Listed race
runners.spotlight: Cost 150,000gns as a yearling and well related; readily justified favouritism in Haydock novice last September but floundered when second favourite for Listed race at Newbury four weeks ago, both over 7f on heavy going; faces different ground and notable opposition on this handicap/seasonal debut but 83 could be a tempting opening mark.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Club EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Supermodel gave me a really nice feel and I had a lot of horse underneath me. I love Haydock and when you're riding horses like her it makes your job easy - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

4:00.race_name: Sky Bet, For The Fans Fillies' Handicap
4:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.3)

runners.name: Grace Angel
runners.comment: All wins at 5f; back on latest winning mark in September; had wind surgery since last seen
runners.spotlight: Four turf wins at about 5f on good and good to firm (handles good to soft); back on latest winning mark and the return to a less testing track can suit, as might wind surgery since last seen; has possibilities.

quotes.race: Retro Industrial Cleaning Services Handicap
quotes.quote: Hopefully we can get Grace Angel to Bahrain after that as she just missed the cut-off point last winter. She loves fast ground, so would be ideal for over there - Darryll Holland, trainer.

runners.name: Elegant Erin

prev_owners.owner: Pall Mall Partners And Sue Hopgood

runners.comment: Won 3 of 6 5f starts after wind op in 2024; in good form off this mark; good shot again
runners.spotlight: Had a good spell after wind surgery in 2024, winning three of her six 5f starts on AW and turf; has returned in good form off this mark, most recently behind an improved rival over C&D last month; handles all surfaces and set to be involved again.

stable_tour.quote: I love her to bits. If she were a human being she'd definitely be marriage material; she's an absolute sweetheart. She's been absolutely fantastic since we got her. She's honest and genuine and gives you absolutely everything. But for some reason, she hasn't quite been seeing out her races, so we gave her a minor wind op the other week. She loves good ground and is ready to go again. She's on 77 and has become potentially well handicapped again. At Carlisle on her most recent start, she was second when she bumped into a progressive filly of Steph Hollinshead's. I'd be expecting her to pay her way again shortly. 28-06-24

runners.name: Angel Shared
runners.comment: Often leads; unsuited by Chester latest but entitled to go well on balance of 5f form
runners.spotlight: Often leads; has won on good ground but well suited by slower; reappeared with a good show at Beverley and was said not to handle the tight turns at Chester next time; has an easier task here in any case and the weights favour her with Elegant Erin on a Carlisle run last May; bold bid likely.

quotes.race: Clarke & Sons Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Angel Shared misbehaved on her debut here but still ran a cracker. She's had experience now and I wouldn't be surprised if she comes back next year even better - Dougie Costello, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Jacquelina
runners.comment: Six wins at 5f in 2024; form tailed off but running well this year; among the principals
runners.spotlight: Leads or races prominently; versatile ground-wise; six wins at about 5f in 2024 and although below best in the autumn she's been giving clear signs of coming back to her best lately, losing her lead only late at Chepstow 11 days ago; easy lead unlikely but can be among the principals.

quotes.race: Trade Centre UK Handicap
quotes.quote: I can't believe the amount Jacquelina has improved. It's kind of by default that she has because she ran on the heavy ground at Windsor and we didn't think she'd like it, but since she's run on soft ground she's just improved. To go and win like that today under a double penalty was pretty impressive. I wake up at about 8st 6lb and this saddle is about 2st! She's got an entry at Hamilton on Thursday but there's also a couple of options at Thirsk for her - Grace McEntee, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Nad Alshiba Green
runners.comment: Two handicap wins in 2024; hampered on return, promising against older sprinters latest
runners.spotlight: Two 5f handicap wins as 2yo; hampered out of it on seasonal return and, like the runner-up Elegant Erin, she might have bumped into one when never able to get to grips with the front-runner over C&D last month; still has potential at 5f.

quotes.race: DragonBet Proud Sponsors Of Bath Racing Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Nad Alshiba Green found six furlongs on slow ground a little bit tiring but she was in the right race there - Oisin Murphy, rider.

runners.name: Nightbird
runners.comment: Won with nothing to spare on AW (5f) in April; held on turf since; now up in grade
runners.spotlight: Not an instant success in handicaps but the return to 5f helped when putting up a game show to win with nothing to spare on AW in April; a subsequent Yarmouth third suggests more will be needed in this higher grade.

runners.name: Galaxy Zoo
runners.comment: Turf debut was a letdown but had won on AW previously and return to 5f can suit
runners.spotlight: Probably didn't need to improve on best 2yo form to make a winning yard debut on Wolverhampton AW (5f) but her first turf start at Doncaster since was a letdown; too soon to be discouraged though and the return to 5f could be what's needed.

runners.name: Tiva
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Improved form when 5f winner on return; well connected; can come on again
runners.spotlight: Major improvement on 2yo AW form when winning a shade cosily at Hamilton (5f, good to firm) on reappearance in May; that was an ordinary race but she's well connected, from the family of Battaash out of mare whose siblings include 6f Group 2 winner Tasleet, and she can come on again.

runners.name: Smooth Silesie
runners.comment: Did well for yard in 2024, winning 5 times, including over C&D; weighted to be involved
runners.spotlight: Tough filly who did very well for this yard in 2024, winning five times on AW and turf, including over C&D; entitled to need her recent reappearance and weighted to make a go of it off this mark.

4:30.race_name: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Stayers Series Qualifier)
4:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.3)

runners.name: The Crafty Mole
runners.comment: Excelled last April-August at 1m6f; back-to-form second at Haydock (2m) ten days ago
runners.spotlight: Excelled last April-August at 1m6f, winning five times on varied ground; second attempt at 2m when back-to-form second at Haydock ten days ago, beaten a head; back up 2lb but respected.

runners.name: Bulldog Spirit
runners.comment: Won with authority in a six-runner race over C&D (good to firm) three weeks ago; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: First start here when he led 2f out to score with authority in a six-runner apprentice race over C&D (good to firm) three weeks ago and that was his second win from four races for this stable; 5lb higher today and his old career-best form wasn't a lot better, but he has to be high on the list.

runners.name: Expressionless
runners.comment: Won this last year; reappearance was promising and steadily run race was an excuse latest
runners.spotlight: Both his 2024 wins were over 1m6f (good/good to firm) and the first of those was in this race; reappearance was promising over just 1m2f, which he failed to build on over C&D later in April but that was a steadily run race and he's probably worth another chance.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: When I pulled Expressionless out a furlong out I thought we were in with a chance. Thankfully he kicked on and ran straight through the line -  Kyle Strydom, jockey.

runners.name: Mandarb
runners.comment: 2-7 in France but well beaten in Britain in his 1m2f Flat handicap and two hurdle races
runners.spotlight: 2-7 in France but well beaten in Britain in his 1m2f Flat handicap and two hurdle races; best watched until giving a more positive signal.

runners.name: Rock N Roll Pinkie
runners.comment: Twice won well over C&D in 2024 and reappeared with a close third of six at Doncaster
runners.spotlight: Twice won well over C&D (on softer than good) in 2024 and reappeared 15 days ago with a close third of six at Doncaster (14.5f, good to firm); firmly in the mix.

runners.name: Currumbin
runners.comment: Did well on AW for new yard over the winter but his last two outings prompt doubts
runners.spotlight: Did well on AW for new yard over the winter, gaining his first career wins over 1m6f at Southwell and 2m at Chelmsford; form dipped on turf one month ago and, although not beaten far, he was last of eight back on AW 17 days ago, so there are doubts about him at present.

quotes.race: Build Your Acca With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: I watched back Currumbin's last few races and it just looks like he stays. Today he relaxed beautifully, he took me there very comfortably and he won well - Kieren Shoemark, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Russian Rumour
runners.comment: C&D winner; creditable reappearance behind Golden Flame at Ascot three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Claimer ridden to win as a 7yo last May (C&D) and October (Bath 2m1f); made a creditable reappearance when fifth (Golden Flame third) in Class 4 at Ascot three weeks ago and he's one of several with each-way claims.

quotes.race: Betway Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Russian Rumour stayed really well. She kept going strongly, handles the surface and the race worked out well - Simon Walker, jockey.

runners.name: Golden Flame

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: All three wins were 2021; twice 2nd on AW this year and creditable third at Ascot latest
runners.spotlight: All three wins were in 2021; twice second on AW this year and creditable third (Russian Rumour fifth) off this career-low mark over 2m at Ascot last month when making his first turf appearance since 2022; thereabouts.

quotes.race: "My Odds Boost" On Betfair Handicap
quotes.quote: It's pretty fast out there. The first two winners made all, it's suiting the front runners and Joe Fanning is the master of it - though, to be fair to Golden Flame, he looked as though he was the last off the bridle there - Jock Bennett, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Gallant Lion
runners.comment: Well backed to win comfortably in this headgear at Chepstow (1m4f) on Friday; no penalty
runners.spotlight: All four wins in summer 2023; mostly in the doldrums since but he tried this headgear for the first time at Chepstow (1m4f; just 3-1) on Friday and won comfortably under Ryan Kavanagh; not proven beyond that but it was an apprentice race, so he does not carry a penalty.

runners.name: Molten Sea
runners.comment: Weak in betting 16 days ago; presumably needed that run and suited by this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Favourite for all four of her handicaps last season, winning twice at Musselburgh (1m4f and 2m) in the autumn; weak in the betting, however, over 1m4f at Newbury on reappearance 16 days ago and faded out of it; presumably both needed that race and suited by this step back up in trip.

quotes.race: Scots Association Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: She's still quite inexperienced. We thought the track might be a touch on the sharp side so were keen to get Molten Sea into her stride and her rhythm and she's done that and showed a good attitude in the later stages. She gets that trip well and I think going up in trip will be a big help. The second horse quickened by her while she was still a bit green and she's really gone through the line well and galloped out nicely afterwards - Callum Rodriguez, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

5:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.3)

runners.name: Sustained
runners.comment: Reappeared with a good front-running second over this trip on Wolverhampton AW 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Sole win (seven races) was debut last June; ran respectably in his first three handicaps (one on turf, on good ground) and reappeared with a good front-running second over this trip on Wolverhampton AW 13 days ago; same mark today and has a chance if the form is repeated.

runners.name: Siam Fox
runners.comment: Won at Windsor (1m, good to firm) last June off 4lb higher; not disgraced on 2025 return
runners.spotlight: Sole win in the last two years was at Windsor (1m, good to firm) last June off 4lb higher; not disgraced on 2025 return and should build on that.

quotes.race: MansionBet #Betstival Handicap
quotes.quote: I wouldn't say Siam Fox liked the track on this ground as he hit every undulation, but he got away with it. I didn't want to take any chances as I think a mile is as short as he wants to go. I think a different track and further will bring out more improvement - Silvestre de Sousa, rider.

runners.name: Intercessor
runners.comment: Left Newland/Insole stable; no tongue-tie or other headgear today, first time since 2021
runners.spotlight: The latest of his seven wins on turf was in April 2024 off today's mark; out of form on last three starts last year, including with slow starts, and has since left the Newland/Insole stable; no tongue-tie or other headgear today, for the first time since 2021.

quotes.race: Fairfax Saddles Grassroots Series Mile Final Handicap
quotes.quote: Intercessor seems to be suited by the mile and he's a very versatile horse considering his size as he is big. He likes it here and we thought he'd run well. He's done nothing but improve all year - John Gallagher, trainer.

runners.name: Havana Prince
runners.comment: Running well but it's possible that the forcing tactics on him are better suited to 7f
runners.spotlight: Surged back to form to justify favouritism at Redcar (7f, good) in April; close third at Ripon (1m) three days ago; dual 1m winner last May/June but it's possible that the forcing tactics on him are better suited to 7f.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Handicap
quotes.quote: Havana Prince is a grand little horse. He may not be the classiest, but he makes up for that by being tough and genuine. That was as quick ground as he wants and you won't be seeing him again until there's a bit of rain. He loves Redcar and Ripon, so we'll wait for the rain and won't have to go out of Yorkshire to find more winning opportunities - Tony Coyle, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Amy Washbourne Bloom Digitally Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I would have been unlucky as I got hampered out of the gate and Havana Prince had to work hard to get into a good position. I thought we got racing plenty early and I needed the line in the last fifty yards - David Nolan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Phone Tag
runners.comment: Back from 1m2f and hood removed when he won under William Pyle at Pontefract (1m, good)
runners.spotlight: Dropped back from 1m2f and had the hood removed when he won under William Pyle at Pontefract (1m, good) seven weeks ago; back up just 2lb and has each-way chance if he settles again.

runners.name: Cliffcake
runners.comment: Three backward steps since 6f AW win; old effectiveness over 1m was not evident on latest
runners.spotlight: Gained his last three wins over 6f on Tapeta, the latest when making all in first-time cheekpieces at Southwell in February; three backward steps since and his old effectiveness over 1m was not evident on latest outing.

runners.name: Kracking
runners.comment: Forceful front-runner; won well at Brighton in April but well beaten both starts since
runners.spotlight: Forceful front-runner who is usually apprentice ridden; looked as good as ever when winning well at Brighton (1m, good to firm; 6lb higher today) in April; well beaten both starts since, however.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Apprentice Handicap (Whips To Be Carried, But Not Used) (RE Series)
quotes.quote: Kracking jumped well and travelled along really well. He was always doing enough and I never really felt any pressure from another horse. Mr [Stuart] Williams was confident so I just let him bowl along. I'm happy to be back with Mr Hannon doing what I love. I could do with an agent to keep the ball rolling into the winter and get a few more rides - Tyrese Cameron, jockey.

runners.name: Charencey
runners.comment: Off 99 days and a number of his stablemates have been shooting back to winning form
runners.spotlight: Two 7f wins last year (one was a dead-heat) on turf off higher marks; bit more to prove over 1m and he's yet to fire in the same way in his last five outings, but absent 99 days since latest and a number of his stablemates have been shooting back to winning form in recent weeks.

runners.name: Drumstick

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen

runners.comment: 0-10; last of 13 when back on turf at Newbury (1m, good) 16 days ago; now tries a hood
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; AW form since November features some creditable efforts over 1m but he was last of 13 when back on turf at Newbury (1m, good; 17-2) 16 days ago; now tries a hood.

runners.name: Dream Pirate
runners.breeder: C R Withers & Mr & Mrs R Reed

prev_owners.owner: N Bromley, S Spampanato, R And E J Reed

runners.comment: It's pretty glaring that his three wins have all been on soft, latest over C&D in October
runners.spotlight: C&D last October saw him register his first win in more than year; 5lb higher today and although he ran respectably on AW reappearance in April, it's pretty glaring that his three wins have all been on soft ground.

quotes.race: Download The Vickers.Bet App Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The weather could have been better and we were worried about the easy ground, but Dream Pirate handled it well - Nick Bromley, owner.

runners.name: Power Of Zeus
runners.comment: Finished last on last four outings; off nearly three months and tries his first headgear
runners.spotlight: 4yo who went the wrong way for Brian Ellison and there's been no revival in his two races for new yard; has now finished last on his last four outings; off nearly three months again and tries his first headgear.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B-D) (EBF Restricted Qualifier)(GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You don't know what to expect but I knew Power Of Zeus was a good athlete and in his first race he didn't know his backside from his elbow. He was tailed off then he improved and improved so I knew that there was a chance he'd do something but I'm shocked - in an extremely nice way. He might have a good future - Keith Brown, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Ripon on his second start last year and then went to Pontefract and ran all right, but he'd probably had enough. He's done tremendously over the winter - putting on weight and growing - and could be a really nice horse this year. He's working away and won't be far off running. 03-04-24

runners.name: Diddy Man
runners.comment: 7f AW win this April latest; back up 7lb but still well treated if he returns to his peak
runners.spotlight: Made all twice last April (1m/7f on AW/soft) and best effort since, down to a career-low mark, when scoring at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) this April; back up 7lb but still well treated if he returns to his peak.

runners.name: Rising Force
runners.comment: Solid sequence from last November onwards, winning at Yarmouth last time; highly respected
runners.spotlight: Third of 21 in an amateur riders' event at Doncaster (25-1) in March and he was delivered wide and late from the back by Jack Callan for a Yarmouth win (also 1m on good; his first turf win) six days later; solid sequence from last November onwards and highly respected after short break.

2:55.race_name: Jimmys Boils Like It Should Be Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.3)

runners.name: Arcimboldo
runners.comment: 12-1, slowly away and always behind in maiden at Windsor (1m, good to firm) five weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Bred to stay 1m2f; 12-1, slowly away and always behind in maiden at Windsor (1m, good to firm) five weeks ago, so looks a longer-term project.

runners.name: Forever Penywern
runners.comment: Closely related to 1m1f Group 2 winner; very much one to note from a top yard
runners.spotlight: First foal; by Bated Breath out of unraced half-sister to 1m1f Group 2 winner Worth Waiting (by Bated Breath), out of 12.5f-1m7f winning close relation to French St Leger winner Montare; newcomer who is very much one to note from a top yard, with the form in this race an unexacting level.

runners.name: Outlandish
runners.comment: Wolverhampton novice (8.6f, AW; 8-1) in March was modest form but stacks went wrong
runners.spotlight: Calyx half-brother to four winners, two useful; about 10l sixth of nine in novice at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW; 8-1) in March was modest form but stacks went wrong, lit up after interference and having both hind legs struck into, so he may yet prove capable of a lot better.

runners.name: Without Burlington
runners.owner: Crest Racing V, J D Gunther & Partners

prev_owners.owner: Ms L G Robinson, J D Gunther & Partners

runners.comment: One of the top form candidates after latest start; may improve again; 30,000gns sale since
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 14l in both starts but taking third in a novice at Redcar (1m2f, good) in April was major improvement and the first two in that contest, who finished well ahead, have performed well in notable races since; changed hands for 30,000gns since (same yard); one of the top candidates on form and may improve again.

runners.name: Coulsea
runners.comment: Mid-division at Ayr; 18l last of 5 at York (1m) but he was severely up against it at 150-1
runners.spotlight: Debut at Ayr (1m, good) in April showed form similar to the best in this line-up; 18l last of five at York (1m, good to firm) 18 days later but he was severely up against it at 150-1 that day, so should be worth another chance.

runners.name: Dabhand
runners.comment: 26,000euros yearling; 11th foal; Coulsty half-brother to winners, some useful; late foal
runners.spotlight: 26,000euros yearling; eleventh foal; Coulsty half-brother to winners Dabadiyan (9.5f-1m6f; RPR 108), Dabulena (9.4f/1m2f; 97), Dabiyr (1m1f-12.5f including Australian Listed) and Multamis (8.6f-1m2f; 90); dam fourth over 1m (65); late foal but market can guide.

runners.name: One More Chrome
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate III
runners.comment: Second 2yo start was disappointing (6-1) but early days and he has a useful pedigree
runners.spotlight: Mid-division last autumn at Leicester (7f, soft) and Redcar (1m, soft); the latter was disappointing, having been backed into 6-1, but these are early days and he has a useful pedigree, bred to stay at least 1m.

runners.name: Bullington Bry
runners.comment: 25-1 at Newbury (7f, good) 16 days ago, always behind but he was badly hampered 2f out
runners.spotlight: 17,000gns yearling; sold unraced last May for £1,000; 25-1 for novice at Newbury (7f, good) 16 days ago, slowly away and always behind but he was badly hampered 2f out; it's possible he will have come on a lot since that run and he needs a second look.

runners.name: Impresario
runners.comment: 50-1 for 7f novice at Newbury and did not show much, tailing off; blinkered this time
runners.spotlight: 50-1 for novice at Newbury (7f, good; the other division to Bullington Bry) 16 days ago and did not show much, tailing off; blinkered this time.

runners.name: Maeva
runners.comment: 14-1 at Kempton (1m, AW) last October, beaten about 8l but some late headway and promise
runners.spotlight: 14-1 and tongue tied in novice at Kempton (1m, AW) last October, beaten about 8l but she made some late headway and showed promise; withdrawn twice this April due to unsuitable ground; hooded today and needs a market check.

runners.name: Satyress
runners.comment: On pedigree she looks a longer-term prospect for longer trips; that was backed up by debut
runners.spotlight: 66-1 and taken down early, ducked right from the highest stall in novice at Newcastle (7f, AW) three weeks ago, pushed along 4f out and well beaten; on pedigree she looks a longer-term prospect for longer trips.

runners.name: Zaramara
runners.comment: Modest form when fourth of six at Yarmouth (7f) but tailed off in a C&D maiden 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Modest form from the rear when fourth of six at Yarmouth (7f) one month ago but tailed off when 66-1 in a C&D maiden (again good to firm) 12 days ago; probably best watched for now.

runners.name: Medway Queen
runners.comment: 8,000gns yearling by Churchill; perhaps one for later
runners.spotlight: 8,000gns yearling; fifth foal; Churchill half-sister to Japanese 7f 2yo dirt winner Rebel Town; dam fourth at 1m2f AW in France (RPR 64), half-sister to 7.4f 2yo Listed winner Zafonical Storm, out of half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 3 winner Wharf and dam of Arc winner Rail Link; perhaps one for later.

3:30.race_name: Jimmys Millionaire Streak Platter EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
3:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.3)

runners.name: Ambishio
runners.comment: Out of unraced half-sister to two 5f Group 1 winners and a 5f Group 3 winner; interesting
runners.spotlight: £45,000 yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Marine Wave (6f including 2yo/Listed; RPR 109) and Jamaheery (6f 2yo; 84); dam unraced half-sister to 5f Group 1 winners Tangerine Trees and Alpha Delphini and 5f Group 3 winner Kurious; looks the part on paper.

runners.name: Ameeq
runners.comment: Showed his inexperience and some significant ability before fading into sixth on debut
runners.spotlight: Slowly away from outside stall and raced too freely on debut at Beverley (5f, good to firm) but showed significant ability before fading into sixth; ought to have learned from that experience and can improve.

runners.name: Capitalization
runners.comment: £260,000 breeze-up 2yo; needs to be taken very seriously on debut
runners.spotlight: £260,000 breeze-up 2yo; fifth foal; half-brother to a Qatari sprint winner; dam placed at 7f (RPR 75), closely related to Listed-placed 7.4f winner Jabhaat; with that price-tag, he needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Chairmanfourtimes
runners.comment: £50,000 breeze-up 2yo; half-brother to a 7f 2yo winner; probably needs to be useful
runners.spotlight: £50,000 breeze-up 2yo; fourth foal; half-brother to 7f 2yo winner Lovely Spirit (RPR 76); dam unraced half-sister to smart Australian 1m-1m2f winner Hawk Island; probably needs to be useful to pose a threat.

runners.name: Charlie Boyo
runners.comment: Failed by only a neck to justify favouritism at Salisbury; sets a good standard
runners.spotlight: First foal from unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 1 winner Arcano; kept on well and failed by only a neck to justify favouritism on debut at Salisbury (5f, good to firm); already sets a good form standard and has obvious scope for improvement.

runners.name: Flash Rascal
runners.comment: First foal; dam 1m2f winner, half-sister to good sprinter Evens And Odds; market may guide
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 1m2f winner (RPR 63), half-sister to smart 5f/6f winner Evens And Odds; worth a glance in the betting but other newcomers look more enticing.

runners.name: Rogue Supremacy
runners.comment: £160,000 breeze-up buy; bred to be a very fast 2yo
runners.spotlight: £160,000 breeze-up 2yo; second foal; dam 5f 2yo winner (RPR 94), closely related to smart 5f/6f winner Angel Alexander, half-sister to 5f 2yo Listed winner Democracy Dilemma; has the right pedigree for this.

runners.name: Wild Thoughts
runners.comment: Well beaten on both starts (5f/6f) and can't be recommended here
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on both starts (5f/6f) and can't be recommended here.

1:55.race_name: Jimmys Killer Mountain Of Prawns Handicap (Div I)
1:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.3)

runners.name: Yafaarr
runners.comment: No solid claims; gelded and cheekpieces; on a modest opening mark, he needs a market check
runners.spotlight: No solid claims after his three qualifying runs (6f, 1m and 7f) but he's been gelded since latest, there's been a whiff of ability and he now has cheekpieces; starting handicap life on a modest mark, he needs a market check.

runners.name: Zaraquelle
runners.comment: Faded in her two handicaps (9.4f/1m) and did not beat many of those rivals
runners.spotlight: Modest form but she's faded in her two handicaps (9.4f/1m) and did not beat many of those rivals; 4lb lower than on handicap debut and drops in class.

runners.name: French Haven
runners.comment: Big change of tactics to come from last to win at Newmarket (1m) 16 days ago; back up 2lb
runners.spotlight: After initial promise, she ran three poor races in a row before a big change of tactics, with Jamie Spencer enlisted, to come from a detached last to win ten-runner handicap at Newmarket (dropped back to 1m, good; 10-1) 16 days ago; back up 2lb but may have turned a corner.

runners.name: Profit Rockit
runners.comment: Blinkered for this reappearance (fifth start) and needs to take a step forward
runners.spotlight: Fourth of seven in Bath novice (5f, heavy) in October looked the best of his four runs as 2yo; took a strong hold when trying 7f in a nursery next time; blinkered for this reappearance and needs to take a step forward.

runners.name: Pay Attention
runners.comment: 0-9; in the frame from off pace in 1m handicaps for new yard in his three races this term
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden, none too consistent in form terms but he made the frame from off the pace in 1m handicaps for new yard in his three races this season; needs a bit extra to win and he's now tongue tied first time.

runners.name: Take The Boat
runners.comment: Won three handicaps this year on the Kempton AW (1m/7f); possible excuses last two outings
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps this year on the Kempton AW (1m/7f) under Rob Hornby; possible excuses on last two outings and she showed some ability on debut in her only race on turf (good); player if best AW form is transferred.

runners.name: Kaleidoscope Eyes
runners.comment: Consistent in handicaps up to 7f on Tapeta for M Appleby; sold for 7,000gns one month ago
runners.spotlight: Exposed after 14 starts but she proved consistent in handicaps on Tapeta for Mick Appleby, including a front-running win over 7f; that's better than last summer's turf form; met interference on her only attempt at 1m and the same happened on latest outing; sold for 7,000gns one month ago and a hood returns for new yard in place of recent cheekpieces.

runners.name: Captain Cess
runners.comment: Close third of nine at Bath (1m, good to firm; gelded since) on handicap/seasonal debut

runners.name: Aphrodites Rock

runners.spotlight: Scored when upped to 1m for handicap debut at Newcastle (AW) in March and placed on both subsequent outings, latterly when third in higher-grade C&D race in late April; leading contender.

runners.spotlight: A maiden after ten runs and not making any progress but chased home a big improver when back up to 1m in refitted cheekpieces at Yarmouth (good to firm) last month and remains unexposed over this sort of trip.

runners.name: Adversary

runners.name: Garibaldi Memory

runners.comment: Unable to land a significant blow in three novice races; may fare better in handicaps

runners.name: Mercurial
runners.comment: Two poor runs this season and likely needs rain to be at his best.
runners.spotlight: Doesn't win very often (2-35); last win came at the Curragh last April from a mark of 69 (6f, heavy); poor runs on two starts this season and likely needs rain to be seen at his best.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mercurial has got a great attitude. He's done it well enough. It's probably not his ground today. This wind and the lack of rain today has made it quite testing and it's holding, sticky ground. He moved so well on fast ground at Bath. He just does enough, he's probably got a little bit more up his sleeve - Hayley Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Facethepuckout
runners.comment: Won handicap last year from a higher mark but form has tapered off, chance if back to form
runners.spotlight: Won at Naas last July from a mark of 82 (7f, yielding); form tapered off towards the end of the season and he didn't put those doubts to bed on his seasonal reappearance last time at Naas when finishing in mid-division (7f, soft-heavy); good chance if coming back to form.

quotes.race: Oktoberfest Weekend Handicap
quotes.quote: Facethepuckout has been consistent all year and been placed five times. That's his ground. The race just worked out for him as they have gone a real good gallop which he needs over seven. Leigh rode him for luck and it's worked out - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer

quotes.race: Racing Club Membership Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Facethepuckout came out of the Curragh race well. He's just sweet and in a good vein of form at the minute. He's well handicapped on his old form but chances are the handicapper will catch up with him - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Listowel Arms Handicap
quotes.quote: Facethepuckout was bought as a fun horse. He has sweetened up lovely and looked a different horse today. He's fit and well and went through the ground - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Derek Ryan Live After Racing Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Donnacha [O'Brien] gave him a nice ride and on his Galway run he was entitled to be thereabouts. He'd probably be okay going a mile as well. He'll go for another nursery and I think there is more progression to come from him - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Ramiro

prev_owners.owner: Brian Ellison Racing Club And Partner

runners.comment: Last win came at this track but returning from a layoff here and likes cut in the ground
runners.spotlight: Six time winner returns from a layoff but his last win came at this track (7f, yielding); likes cut in the ground so would ideally like some rain; on a career high mark so perhaps he is one for another day.

quotes.race: Kelleher Feeds & Agri Suppliers Ballymullen, Tralee Handicap
quotes.quote: Ramiro was unlucky at Galway and he had a couple of injuries since. We bided our time and it worked out great - Martin Ferris, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: David McManus Bookmaker Handicap
quotes.quote: I was confident enough coming here as we took him to the Curragh on Saturday and he done a very good bit of work for Gearoid. He loves the ground and we'll see what the handicapper gives him now. I think he's a horse we are going to have plenty of fun with - Ian O'Connor, trainer

runners.name: Gerrits Gem
runners.comment: Out of form since handicap win last October, on lifetime low mark so not without a chance
runners.spotlight: Out of form since winning a Cork handicap from a mark of 74 last October (1m, yielding); returned from a mini-break with a down the field finish at the Curragh last time (6f, good); has dropped to a lifetime low mark and has won at this trip so not without a chance.

runners.name: Never Shout Never
runners.comment: Has been running consistently and only .5L behind Tawaazon last time; on a dangerous mark
runners.spotlight: Has been running consistently on AW this year; carried that over to turf with a .75L second at the Curragh on penultimate start (5f, good); went close again last time when .5L behind Tawaazon at Naas (6f, good); dropped 2lb more and he is now on a dangerous mark.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Never Shout Never is a horse that can progress through the winter months. We will mix it between five and six, more than likely keep him fresh for the next five. We'll see where it takes us then - Stephen Thorne, trainer.

quotes.race: Buy Tickets Online At www.corkracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: I spoke to Fozzy and Joey Sheridan about Never Shout Never and we were keen on going forward and not pulling out of him, just to get him breathing right. I knew he would get through the ground well as he's a big, strong horse - Jamie Powell, jockey.

runners.name: Rappell
runners.comment: Dropped 6lb since finishing behind Tawaazon but still 6lb higher than last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Finished behind Never Shout Never and Tawaazon at Naas on penultimate start (6f, good); followed up with a decent midfield finish at the Curragh last time (7f, good); dropped 6lb since his Naas run but he is still 6lb higher than his last winning mark.

quotes.race: Castle Arch Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Rappell is a fine, big horse and learning away. He jumped and travelled and always had something to aim at. Once he gets to the front he thinks he has done enough - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Friday Fairynights 7th June Handicap
quotes.quote: Rappell  was green and ran really well. He's definitely come on a lot from it. I think he's a grand horse, his mother was very good - Paul Flynn, trainer

runners.name: Free Solo
runners.comment: Won nicely on penultimate start, has won from 5lb higher so can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won nicely on penultimate start at the Curragh (7f, good); raised 8lb and not a bad effort (4.5L seventh) when upped to a mile on most recent start; has won from a 5lb higher mark before so he can't be confidently ruled out.

quotes.race: Frank Conroy Irish EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Finally we got a colt to win. Free Solo learned a lot at Naas and he was just a baby there. He jumped out and stopped rather than jumping and going. He was a different horse today. He'll improve with racing - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has had only six runs in his life but has shown plenty of ability. A winner over a mile, he finished runner-up in successive Listed races last season. I think he'll progress this year and is definitely capable of winning at that level. I feel he's probably best over seven furlongs. 17-03-21

runners.name: Velvet Skies
runners.comment: Had some of these behind when .75L second last time, raised 2lb; one for the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Beaten .75L at the Curragh last time (6f, good); horse who finished in front of him was subsequently beaten 4.5L by Tawaazon at Naas; had a number of these rivals in behind him on Curragh start and only raised 2lb; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: White Clover
runners.owner: James V Purcell & Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Finished 2L behind Velvet Skies on last start, likes good ground and can go well
runners.spotlight: Finished two lengths behind Velvet Skies at the Curragh on most recent start (6f, good); meets that rival 5lb better off now; won a Navan maiden on the eighth attempt last October (5f, yielding); likes good ground and can go well.

runners.name: Linger For Longer
runners.comment: Better than performance last time on seasonal return, has won a handicap off current mark
runners.spotlight: Returned from a layoff last time at the Curragh and finished last of 27 runners; won two on the bounce in 2024 including a Tipperary handicap off the same mark as her current one (7f, soft); she is better than her performance last time.

quotes.race: Tote, Never Beaten By SP Rated Race
quotes.quote: Linger For Longer can buck out in front but Dylan was happy to let the other two go on. Six or seven is her trip and easier ground. I had notions of taking her out because of the ground - Austin Leahy, trainer.

runners.name: Tawaazon
runners.comment: Won for first time in two years last time with a number of rivals behind, raised just 1lb
runners.spotlight: Got his first win since 2023 last time at Naas (6f, good) and finished in front of many of his rivals today in the process; raised just 1lb for his win so he is entitled to put in a good showing here again but he may not be the most reliable.

runners.name: Nezeeh
runners.comment: Raised 6lb for Cork win on penultimate start but has been running consistently
runners.spotlight: Broke long losing streak with a win at Cork two weeks ago (5f, good); unable to follow up with a 10lb claimer on board three days ago at Fairyhouse when finishing a 1.25L second (6f, good); raised 6lb for Cork win but he is running consistently.

runners.name: Kilmood Susan
runners.comment: Consistent filly on a reasonable mark for handicap debut, can make presence felt
runners.spotlight: Runner-up four times from from six starts in maidens; drops back in trip after trying 7f last time; makes her handicap debut here on a mark that appears reasonable; consistent and reliable filly can make her presence felt.

runners.name: Skillman Ave
runners.comment: Finished behind a few of these last time, was returning from a layoff so can improve.
runners.spotlight: Dropped 4lb for her 5L eighth to Tawaazon last time at Naas (6f, good); a number of those who finished in front of her that day reoppose; she was returning from a layoff that day so there is some scope for improvement; wears a first time visor.

3:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO YIELDING, Good in places

runners.name: Chazzesmee
runners.comment: Last season's Irish Lincoln winner, fifth in William Hill Lincoln, first run in 11 months
runners.spotlight: Heavy ground Irish Lincoln winner last March; fifth in William Hill Lincoln, was comprehensively beaten out of handicap company in a Curragh Group 3 when last seen (1m2f, yielding to soft); returns from 337-day absence.

quotes.race: Nua Healthcare Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I though Chazzesmee did it well off a lay-off. We'll see how he is during the week and he's in the English Lincoln on Saturday. A 5lb penalty would get him into it. He's never been short of ability, and we ironed out a few kinks in him. We brought him over to Saratoga last year and he got a stone bruise and couldn't run on the day. Then when he was coming back he got stuck in some airport for four days as a vet was giving out about some paperwork. We just ran out of time to run him. He broke his pelvis in Dundalk as a three-year-old, so that's why he was off for a year - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

runners.name: Kilt
runners.comment: Winner for William Haggas; makes Irish debut and seasonal reappearance
runners.spotlight: Makes seasonal reappearance on just his sixth start; some nice form last season, including when winning a Newmarket novice race (1m, good) and a good sixth at the same track in what turned out to be a hot novice race; ahead of a few of these on ratings.

runners.name: Admiral Churchill
runners.comment: Hardy winner of Limerick maiden; he is on an upward curve and is a key player
runners.spotlight: Hardy winner of a Limerick maiden in April (7f, soft); that was his best performance in four starts and he may have benefitted from being gelded or the first-time blinkers which are retained here; he is on an upward curve and is a key player.

runners.name: Nobler
runners.comment: Placed in all five starts; improvement needed but receives weight from all his rivals

4:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO YIELDING, Good in places

runners.name: El Bello
runners.comment: Often a slow-starter, all five wins have been at this trip, unplaced over 1m last time

quotes.race: Bet On The Best Night Out At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: El Bello was tough all the way to the line. Two horses came alongside him and he battled well. You'd like to think he could get an extra furlong - Dan King, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A lightly raced gelding, things are really starting to click with him now. He won back-to-back races at Wolverhampton and Newcastle, both over 7f. He went up a fair bit to 80 from an opening mark of 71 - the handicapper actually hiked him 8lb for his last win at Gosforth Park. He relished the stiff 7f there and although he won at Wolverhampton I was not sure the track suited him, and my fears were proved correct last week when he was never happy and although he ran on well at the end it is not his course. We will keep him to stiffer venues in the future and he can win again. 25-05-22

runners.name: Distillate
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith

prev_owners.owner: N O'Hare/G Devlin/J McCrory/Kabin Racing Syndicate
Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Joseph McCrory/Kabin Racing Synd

runners.name: Seven Eleven
runners.comment: Won a 5f Down Royal nursery in 2023, weak form last year; struggled on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won a 5f Down Royal nursery in 2023; weak form last year; struggled at Gowran on stable debut

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We changed Seven Eleven's training at home, we put a tongue bit on her to keep her tongue down. It had been getting over the bit and wasn't helping the jockeys, so through no fault of her own she has ended up well handicapped. She might go on the all-weather and I will use that program to educate and teach her - Johnny Levins, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Saxon Kingdom
runners.comment: Recent 1m Gowran winner, may struggle to uphold Killarney form with Still She Blooms
runners.spotlight: Reversed previous Killarney form with the well-fancied Harry The Rogue when scoring over 1m at Gowran 11 days ago; may struggle to uphold Killarney form with Still She Blooms on revised terms.

runners.name: Dinamine
runners.comment: Off the mark at Gowran at the 35th attempt, not sure to uphold form with Still She Blooms
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on Flat at the 35th attempt when making stable/seasonal debut at Gowran (7f, heavy); down the field at the same venue on next start; unplaced in a claiming hurdle on latest; may struggle to uphold Gowran form with Still She Blooms.

runners.name: Han Solo
runners.comment: Two wins on good ground at Cork, should be better for a run at that venue in April
runners.spotlight: Has won twice on turf, both on good ground at Cork; should be better for a run at that venue in April on seasonal debut.

runners.name: Cu Chulainn
runners.comment: AW winner, struggled in six runs last year; tailed off on seasonal debut at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Both wins gained on AW in Britain; losing run stretches back nearly three years; struggled in six runs last year; tailed off on seasonal debut at Limerick.

runners.name: Manhattan Dandy
runners.comment: Last two wins have been on heavy ground and hard to win with at the best of times, 3-64
runners.spotlight: Last two wins have been on heavy ground and hard to win with at the best of times with a strike-rate of 3-64; not a bad run when fifth at Roscommon, with previous Leopardstown second Browned Off among those behind.

runners.name: Browned Off
runners.comment: Second over this trip at Leopardstown, failed to reproduce that form at Roscommon
runners.spotlight: Was having only her second run in a handicap when a front-running second in a Leopardstown event won by Are You In Or Out; failed to reproduce that form at Roscommon.

runners.name: Dark Enigma
runners.comment: Went close over 5f at Down Royal a year ago; weak form in three sprint outings this year
runners.spotlight: Went close over 5f at Down Royal a year ago; weak form in three sprint outings this year; hood tried last time, discarded now.

runners.name: Dazzling Spirit
runners.comment: Useful form in 2022 for Tom Mullins, stable debut was encouraging, beaten favourite since
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner, including over this trip; showed her best form for Tom Mullins in 2022; out of sorts last season; made a promising start for this stable when third over an extended 1m1f at Gowran early last month; disappointed when favourite at Killarney.

quotes.race: St. Patrick's Well Handicap
quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit won here last year and I hoped coming back here would work. She ran away with him down the hill but Jamie gets on well with her, that's his fourth win on her - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN The Advantage Series Handicap
quotes.quote: During the summer jockeys were saying Dazzling Spirit needed a little bit further but she just wouldn't let herself down on the ground. On the soft she's letting herself down and she's getting quicker, that's why I took a chance coming back to seven. At home she's very speedy and her half-sister Powersville was a five or six-furlong mare. She'll go to Galway now for a seven-furlong handicap and that might see her out for the season - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: St. Patrick's Well Handicap
quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit got a lovely run up the rail. She travelled well and hit the line well, she was still a bit green and ran around a bit. She was a bit unlucky last time but she enjoyed herself today - Jamie Powell, rider.

runners.name: Eagles Whistle
runners.comment: Fair fifth at Killarney, not sure to uphold form with beaten favourite Dazzling Spirit
runners.spotlight: Best handicap run so far when fifth over 1m at Killarney; not sure to uphold form with Dazzling Spirit who failed to run to market expectations.

runners.name: Liamo
runners.comment: 0-12, one of his better efforts when sixth of 24 over this trip at the Curragh last autumn
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; one of his better efforts when sixth of 24 over this trip at the Curragh last October; failed to build on that at Dundalk the following month.

runners.name: Hell Left Loose
runners.comment: Reserve, no success since 2021, missed last season, struggled at Naas on his comeback
runners.spotlight: No success since 2021 Laytown win over 6f; missed all of last season; struggled at Naas on his comeback.

quotes.race: King John's Castle Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He's after winning three now and the only day he was beaten was over five (furlongs) at the Curragh. Between six and seven furlongs is ideal and today's ground was fine - Denis Hogan, trainer of Hell Left Loose

quotes.race: Navanracecourse.ie Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He travelled really well. The shorter trip the last day didn't suit him and the bit extra trip today was more up his street. He likes him and hopefully there is another day or two in him - Joe Doyle, rider of Hell Left Loose

4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO YIELDING, Good in places

runners.name: Empress Alma

prev_owners.owner: E Hughes & Carmel Yore & Darren Cahill & Kiva Cromwell

runners.comment: Three handicap wins last season, should be better for Gowran run behind Inchiquin Star
runners.spotlight: Three handicap wins last season, including over 2m at Thurles win in October; should be better for his seasonal return when sixth behind today's rival Inchiquin Star over 1m6f at Gowran; beaten only 4 1/2l, extra distance in her favour.

quotes.race: Care At Home Services Handicap
quotes.quote: Empress Alma is a good sized filly and I think she'll improve again going 1m4f. Hopefully she can step forward from that and win again - Gary Carroll, rider.

runners.name: Dark Note
runners.comment: Won the charity race at Punchestown festival, confirmed wellbeing with Killarney third
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner; spent the winter over jumps; won the charity race at the Punchestown festival; reportedly got upset in the stalls at Killarney, overcame that disadvantage to post a good effort in taking third behind two of the market leaders.

quotes.race: Killyhevlin Lakeside Hotel & Lodges Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dark Note had a very good run last time. I knew Jack was under pressure when he came alongside me. He probably got a head in front of me but me fellow ran all the way to the line - Cian Quirke, rider.

quotes.race: John Madden & Sons Apprentice Claiming Race
quotes.quote: I was happy enough. Dark Note got a lovely position all the way around in the box seat. I got a lovely split but I probably went too early. He got very lairy when he got to the front, I could've covered him up for a bit longer.  But look he got the job done and he done it well - Jake Coen, jockey.

runners.name: Quiz Test
runners.comment: 1m2f Cork winner during a 2023 campaign marked by consistency, not at his best since then
runners.spotlight: 1m2f Cork winner during a 2023 campaign marked by consistency, had four runs last year, the pick of those when runner-up at Leopardstown over 1m7f; a long way below his best over 1m4f at the Curragh on reappearance; still 5lb above the mark at which he achieved his sole win.

runners.name: Say It So
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Fine spell of form (Flat and hurdles) between August and November last year, no recent run
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a fine spell of form between August and November last year, winning twice hurdle and twice on the Flat; defied an 11lb rise for a 1m6f Navan win when scoring over 2m at Dundalk; given a break after an unplaced hurdles run at Limerick in December.

quotes.race: Dundalk Stadium Gift Vouchers Available Online Handicap
quotes.quote: Say It So did it comfortably and I'd imagine that would be him for the year. W will look forward to next year with him. He starts slowly whether it is Flat or National Hunt, he likes to come wide and likes his own room - Conor Mcnamara, rider.

runners.name: Fianna
runners.comment: Kept on late in a 1m4f apprentice contest at Roscommon on handicap debut, can improve
runners.spotlight: Fair form in maidens; left an impression she could stay further when keeping on in the straight in a 1m4f apprentice contest at Roscommon on handicap debut; open to improvement.

runners.name: Allo Al Khawaneej
runners.comment: Ordinary Flat form for Owen Burrows, won a Kilbeggan maiden hurdle on penultimate start
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 2,000 Guineas and St James's Palace runner-up Delegator; ordinary form at around 1m4f on the Flat for Owen Burrows; off the mark on second start for this yard when winning Kilbeggan maiden hurdle last month; failed to make any significant impact in better company at Cork.

runners.name: Elle Dorado Rock
runners.comment: Had plenty in hand when scoring over 1m5f at Navan, good chance he can defy an 8lb rise
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m at Dundalk in January, beating Scott Lang; has maintained good form with Gowran second on heavy and an emphatic win over 1m5f at Navan on soft; different ground now but his Dundalk win suggests it should not be an issue; , good chance he can defy an 8lb rise.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap
quotes.quote: Elle Dorado Rock was suited when they started to race halfway down the back and he was able to pick them off. He really needs a couple of furlongs extra - Robbie Colgan, jockey.

runners.name: Scott Lang
runners.comment: Unplaced in four starts since a 2m win at Dundalk, seventh behind Elle Dorado Rock latest
runners.spotlight: Sole turf win came at Navan three years ago; unplaced in four starts since beating Inchiquin Star over 2m at Dundalk; seventh behind Elle Dorado Rock at Navan on latest.

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee On All Win Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Scott Lang only travelled okay and got a nice lead. In behind horses, he wasn't really travelling but I just kicked him into the gap just to see what would happen and he picked up nicely. He put it to bed well - Luke McAteer, rider.

runners.name: The Dubliner
runners.comment: Winner over 1m4f on heavy in France last November, out of form on last three French starts
runners.spotlight: Winner over 1m4f on heavy in France last November; out of form on last three French starts; hard to assess.

runners.name: Chatterbox
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who has shown his best form at Killarney, not a strong contender
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who has shown his best form at Killarney; needs to improve considerably from a Rsocommon run; not a strong contender.

runners.name: Inchiquin Star
runners.comment: Three-time hurdles winner, opened his Flat account at Gowran at the 20th attempt, up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdles winner; opened his Flat account at Gowran at the 20th attempt; overall Flat profile remains a cause for concern.

runners.name: Make Good
runners.comment: Versatile five-time winner, bright start to the season when fifth behind Elle Dorado Rock
runners.spotlight: Versatile five-time winner at an early stage of his career; made a bright start to the season when fifth behind Elle Dorado Rock at Navan; stays well.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Bristol Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The trip was a bit of an unknown. John (McConnell) was pretty sure Make Good wanted at least two and a half miles but because of the ground we didn't actually go too quick, so it wasn't a slog. He has had 35 runs before today and a tough, strong horse was always going to be suited by these conditions - Richard Johnson, jockey.

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rentals Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: There didn't seem to be much pace so I didn't want it to turn into a sprint like the last day in Fairyhouse. He missed the last there and got beaten.I wanted to go a good gallop as he seems to have plenty of stamina. He jumped great and did the job nicely - Simon Torrens, rider

runners.name: Dumb Love
runners.comment: Winning hurdler, outstayed by two rivals at Gowran but worth another shot at the trip
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles last September; losing run on the Flat since a heavy ground Bellewstown maiden in 2023 when trained by Ger Lyons; outstayed by two rivals at Gowran recently but worth another shot at the trip.

quotes.race: Roxyfet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dumb Love is rated 60-odd on the Flat and runs over a mile and a quarter, so I knew she'd have the pace. A good friend of mine works for Ger, so he told me all about her. He said 'don't be hanging around, drive her on from the top of the hill' and he was right - Brian Hughes, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Ratoathvets.ie Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Dumb Love loved the soft ground and saw out the mile well. The blinkers sharpened her up today, the plan was to jump and be forward enough. I got an easy enough lead which suited her and she battled it out well - Jack Kearney, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Saga Des Aigles
runners.comment: Ordinary form over hurdles in two runs for this stable, perhaps worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form over hurdles in two runs for this stable; weak Flat form for her previous trainer; perhaps worth a market check; Liam Keniry aboard.

runners.name: Ifitwasme
runners.owner: Cian Wilmot & Damien Wilmot & Joe Wilmot & Mike Wilmot
runners.comment: Wide-margin handicap hurdle winner here last September, tailed off on Flat on next start
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin handicap hurdle winner here last September, tailed off on Flat on next start; trainer also runs Say It So.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ifitwasme got what we felt was a fair mark over hurdles last year so we've had this race in mind for him for quite a while - Eric McNamara, trainer.

runners.name: Autumn Twist
runners.comment: Reserve, recent maiden hurdle winner, possibly well enough treated on French Flat form
runners.spotlight: Reserve, recent maiden hurdle winner, possibly well enough treated on French Flat form.

5:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO YIELDING, Good in places

runners.name: Duke Silver
runners.comment: Winner of a handicap hurdle over 2m4f, placed over 3m on latest, others may have more pace
runners.spotlight: Winner of a handicap hurdle over 2m4f at Wexford last October; placed over 3m at the same venue on latest; others may have more pace. stablemate Lark In The Mornin is much superior over hurdles.

runners.name: Gentleman Joe
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Winning hurdler/AW Flat winner, ran well in a 1m6f Royal Ascot handicap last season
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler/AW Flat winner; ran well when fifth of 16 behind the Willie Mullins-trained Belloccio in the 1m6f Copper Horse Handicap at Royal Ascot last season; off for ten months, may need this.

quotes.race: Camida Perfect Chemistry Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gentleman Joe is a big fellow and takes a bit of pulling together. Rachael said he did everything right and hopefully he can keep progressing - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

runners.name: Goin
runners.comment: Two 1m4f wins in Germany and Listed-placed over 2m, always at the back on Irish debut
runners.spotlight: Two 1m4f wins in Germany and Listed-placed over 2m; always at the back on Irish debut; others preferred at these weights.

runners.name: Jet Setting Jim
runners.comment: Bumper/hurdles winner, made no impact on Flat debut at Killarney, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdles winner; made no impact when taking on useful types on Flat debut at Killarney; faces another tough task here.

runners.name: Lark In The Mornin
runners.comment: Course 1m winner, questions after two below-par efforts in high-profile handicap hurdles
runners.spotlight: Course 1m winner on 2022 on debut; convincing winner of last year's Fred Winter on heavy ground; fifth in the Swinton last May; fair run at Leopardstown in December after a break; below best at two major jumps 2025 festivals, well fancied on both occasions; questions to answer.

quotes.race: Boodles Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered As The Fred Winter) (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were very worried about the rain, as we had a pretty strong view that he wanted better ground to be seen to best effect, but I thought that 'JJ' gave Lark In The Mornin a fantastic ride and found the best of the ground all the way around. He had plenty in the locker jumping the last, then pricked his ears. We thought that he was coming here with a real live chance, but so much rain fell last night that we had a conversation about whether we'd run or not. Luckily we did, and he seemed to handle it - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Buckley Agri New Holland Irish EBF Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: That was nice. I think Lark In The Mornin is a good horse. He's still a big baby but he's a nice looking animal. Shane (Crosse) reckons he's grown since the barrier trial, he thought he was a bigger horse to sit on today. Please God he's going to be quite smart and he's going to make a lovely three-year-old. He does have a kick as well, which he showed at Dundalk, and he showed it on that ground there today - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his debut at Listowel. We see him as a middle-distance horse and I'm thinking of starting him off in a mile and a quarter winners' race at Cork for three-year-olds and we will see from there. If that went well then I suppose he would step into stakes company. I thought it was a real smart performance at Listowel as it can be a tricky place to run first time out. He has trained well since. 06-04-23

He won a Listowel maiden on the Flat as a two-year-old and had just the one start at Cork this year in April. He's a horse we've always liked and he'll start off in a juvenile hurdle in the next few weeks. If he takes to hurdling then he could be a good prospect. 27-11-23

runners.name: Sorrentino
runners.comment: Flat-bred gelding, easy winner of a bumper at Ballinrobe over a year ago, absent since
runners.spotlight: Evens favourite for his debut in a Punchestown festival bumper in 2023 but slipped up at halfway; returned from a year off to record a smooth success in a bumper at Ballinrobe over a year ago; absent since; presumably has had training issues.

quotes.race: Harrington Concrete & Quarries INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Sorrentino has obviously had a good bit of trouble - little niggly issues, nothing major, but sometimes when they get to his age they're stronger horses. I think he was only eighty-per-cent ready there and we weren't training him hard, as we just wanted to get him to the track. We took the very safety-first route (on the outer) there and it didn't matter. Obviously with his pedigree (by New Bay) he could go back to the Flat so that's an option - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

runners.name: Talking Tough
runners.comment: Low-rated handicapper, badly treated by the race conditions here, up against it
runners.spotlight: Low-rated handicapper; badly treated by the race conditions here; up against it.

quotes.race: Claytonhotelgalway.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Billy (Lee) said they went good and hard early on and when he hit the hill, the rising ground helped him. He did the same at Sligo when he finished well and that is the secret to him. We are giving him plenty of racing but he is still a little ball of a horse and saves a little bit for himself all the time. We'll have to think about running him again later in the week with him - Mick Mulvany, trainer

runners.name: Toto Too
runners.comment: Bumper/hurdles winner, has had bleeding issues, placed on AW, tough task in this company
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdles winner; has had bleeding issues; placed over 1m4f AW on the first of two Flat outings; tough task in this company on the evidence of an unplaced Bellewstown run.

quotes.race: Treo Eile Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Toto Too coped with the ground and got through it well. He jumped well apart from the second-last and that will improve him. He will need more experience but he could potentially be a Galway Hurdle horse - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Guaranteed Multiples All Shops Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Toto Too is a lovely horse. He schooled well at home and I was keen to get him out on nice ground, but he can mix on softer ground heading into the winter. He could develop into a nice novice hurdler - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Zentopia
runners.comment: Never in the first three in 17 outings, impossible to make a case for him
runners.spotlight: Never in the first three in 17 outings; impossible to make a case for him.

runners.name: Colonia Victoria
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Scea Bissons, Mr
runners.comment: Winning favourite over hurdles at Cork last month, solid Flat form in Germany, respected
runners.spotlight: Former German-trained mare; 1m2f winner in France; unplaced all eight runs in stakes races but often ran respectably; made a bright styart for Paul Nolan whne fourth in a decent 2m4f Leopardstown mares' maiden in March; winning favourite at Cork on second attempt; trip should be fine and should be in the mix here with Josh Williamson claiming 7lb.

quotes.race: O'Flynn Motors Mallow Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Colonia Victoria had a nice run first time out in Leopardstown. There was no great pace early on and I thought we were going to get done for speed. She jumped great down the straight and that sort of sealed it then. We'll see what sort of a mark she'll get now. I'm thankful to get a win on the board and see where we go from here. We thought the ground here would even be a little bit softer, that's why I wasn't as concerned about the trip. I'd say it is not as soft as it looks and is not riding like winter ground or anything like that. She was sourced by Tom Malone and she wasn't over expensive. She's value going forward and she has a lovely pedigree - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.name: Couldntmakeitup
runners.comment: Place claims once more but looks vulnerable for win purposes
runners.spotlight: Bang there when third in a Naas maiden (2m3f) but then beaten some 17l when second at Kilbeggan; place claims but looks vulnerable for win purposes.

runners.name: Eye On The Ball
runners.comment: First foal out of a sister to high-class hurdler Darlan; market can guide
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unplaced in bumper/2m-2m5f hurdles, sister to bumper/high-class 2m hurdle winner Darlan; the market should be instructive.

runners.name: I Am River
runners.comment: Odds-on for a Fairyhouse bumper last year in which he pulled up after losing his action
runners.spotlight: Cost 210,000euros as a 3yo and from the family of Wichita Lineman and Rhinestone Cowboy; went off odds-on for a Fairyhouse bumper on the first day of 2024 and was pulled up after losing his action; could still be a smart prospect.

runners.name: In The Trenches
runners.comment: 0-25 but has plenty of placed form over hurdles and fences; shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Now 0-25 under Rules but runner-up for a tenth time when going down narrowly in a handicap chase at Tipperary 24 days ago (2m); also has placed form in maidens and unlikely to be far away.

runners.name: Keep Kool Coko
runners.comment: Has finished runner-up in three maiden hurdles and was beaten by his market rival latest
runners.spotlight: Has finished runner-up in three maiden hurdles and was beaten by his market rival in the latest at Clonmel (2m3f, good; handles softer); turn looks near.

runners.name: Orkneys Jack
runners.comment: Beaten nearly 30l in his first maiden and was pulled up in the second; now hooded
runners.spotlight: Beaten nearly 30l in his first maiden and was pulled up in the second; now hooded.

runners.name: Tedworth
runners.comment: Early signs have not been encouraging, in two bumpers and three maidens
runners.spotlight: Early signs have not been encouraging, in two bumpers and three maidens (2m-2m6f).

runners.name: Twelve Tribes
runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper and no worthwhile form in two maiden hurdles
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper and no worthwhile form in two maiden hurdles; will find his level further down the line.

runners.name: Western Note
runners.comment: Was beaten under 12l at Down Royal and showed some promise for the future
runners.spotlight: Weak in the betting for a newcomer from this yard when sixth of 18 in a maiden at Down Royal (2m1f, good; 33-1); was beaten under 12l and showed some promise for the future.

runners.name: Whiskey On Ice
runners.comment: Overcame early interference to stay on for third in a 2m4f maiden at Sligo
runners.spotlight: Overcame early interference to stay on for third in a 2m4f maiden at Sligo and looks mildly progressive; each-way claims.

runners.name: Damoso
runners.comment: Insufficient promise in a course maiden (80-1) to be of interest in the short term
runners.spotlight: Insufficient promise in a course maiden (80-1) to be of interest in the short term.

runners.name: Aine Beag
runners.comment: Showed enough in bumpers to believe she has a future but this a belated return to action
runners.spotlight: Showed enough in her bumpers to believe she has a future but this is a belated return to action.

runners.name: Belle Of Boston
runners.comment: Completely tailed off in maidens at Ballinrobe and Sligo; instantly opposable
runners.spotlight: Completely tailed off in maidens at Ballinrobe and Sligo; instantly opposable.

runners.name: Sea Of Doubt
runners.comment: Has ability but beaten on Saturday and likely to remain vulnerable in races of this nature
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in maidens at Tramore and Downpatrick before finishing well beaten at Tramore on Saturday; likely to remain vulnerable in races of this nature.

runners.name: Belle Coko
runners.comment: First foal; dam once-raced sister to useful French 2m2f-2m4f hurdle winner Best Sholo
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam once-raced sister to useful French 2m2f-2m4f hurdle winner Best Sholo; hooded for debut.

runners.name: Eponine Etoile
runners.comment: Very minor Flat form in four runs from 1m to 1m4f; no real appeal on this change of codes
runners.spotlight: Very minor Flat form in four runs from 1m to 1m4f; no real appeal on this change of codes.

runners.name: No Demand
runners.comment: Reserve; tailed off in a Sligo maiden hurdle at odds of 50-1
runners.spotlight: Reserve; tailed off in a Sligo maiden hurdle at odds of 50-1.

runners.name: Annilogs Force
runners.comment: Reserve; just minor pointing promise and tailed off on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Reserve; just minor pointing promise and tailed off on hurdling debut; blinkers replace cheekpieces.

runners.name: Mountain Ahead
runners.comment: Reserve; beaten 17l into fourth in a 3m point just over 12 months ago; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Reserve; beaten 17l into fourth in a good-ground point just over 12 months ago; can only be watched.

runners.name: Huntsgrove
runners.comment: Rated 109, a shade fortunate to score latest, should stay this trip, more needed to win
runners.spotlight: A bit fortunate to get off the mark by a head at the fifth attempt over hurdles in 2m4f Sligo maiden latest (good), benefitting from a late mistake by the eventual runner-up; rated 109 and carries 7lb penalty in this better race; should stay this longer trip but needs more.

runners.name: Toad Hall
runners.comment: Downpatrick maiden winner, hung right latest at Cheltenham, should stay this far, claims
